org.diirt.service.exec

Class ExecServiceProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.diirt.service.AbstractFileServiceProvider
      • org.diirt.service.exec.ExecServiceProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServiceProvider

    public class ExecServiceProvider
extends AbstractFileServiceProvider
    A service factory that crawls a directory for xml files, and creates an exec service from each of them.
    Author:
    carcassi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExecServiceProvider()
      Creates a new factory using the default configuration directory.
      ExecServiceProvider(File directory, boolean includeGenericExecService)
      Creates a new factory that reads from the given directory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExecServiceProvider

        public ExecServiceProvider(File directory,
                           boolean includeGenericExecService)
        Creates a new factory that reads from the given directory.

        If the directory does not exist, it simply returns an empty set.

        Parameters:
        directory - a directory
        includeGenericExecService - whether to include the general purpose exec service

      • ExecServiceProvider

        public ExecServiceProvider()
        Creates a new factory using the default configuration directory.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Description copied from interface: ServiceProvider
        Returns the name of the service provider.
        Returns:
        a short name

      • createService

        public Service createService(File file)
                      throws Exception
        Description copied from class: AbstractFileServiceProvider
        Creates a service from the given file.

        Implementors of this method need not to care about logging and service registration.

        Specified by:
        createService in class AbstractFileServiceProvider
        Parameters:
        file - a file in the configuration directory
        Returns:
        the new service or null if no service corresponds to the file
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is a problem creating the service from the file

      • additionalServices

        public Collection<Service> additionalServices()
        Description copied from class: AbstractFileServiceProvider
        Creates additional services that are not read from files. This can be useful in case the service provider has additional services that are not user defined through configuration files.

        Implementors need not to care about logging and service registration.

        Overrides:
        additionalServices in class AbstractFileServiceProvider
        Returns:
        a collection of services
